Detailed Description

Functions for mouse, keyboard and joystick input.

Joystick input is used to emulate mouse on platforms that don't have a pointing device, ie: the GP2X.

Function Documentation

int Get_input ( void   ) 

This is the keyboard/mouse/joystick input polling function.

Returns 1 if a significant changed occurred, such as a mouse button pressed or depressed, or a new keypress was in the keyboard buffer. The latest input variables are held in Key, Key_ANSI, Mouse_X, Mouse_Y, Mouse_K. Note that Key and Key_ANSI are not persistent, they will be reset to 0 on subsequent calls to Get_input().

References Compute_paintbrush_coordinates(), Cursor_displace(), Directional_delay, Directional_down, Directional_down_left, Directional_down_right, Directional_last_move, Directional_left, Directional_right, Directional_step, Directional_up, Directional_up_left, Directional_up_right, Display_cursor(), Flush_update(), Handle_joystick_movement(), Handle_joystick_press(), Handle_joystick_release(), Handle_key_press(), Handle_key_release(), Handle_mouse_click(), Handle_mouse_move(), Handle_mouse_release(), Handle_window_exit(), Handle_window_resize(), Input_new_mouse_X, Input_new_mouse_Y, Key, Key_ANSI, Mouse_moved, Mouse_X, and Mouse_Y.

Referenced by Button_Message_initial(), Get_color_behind_window(), Main_handler(), Move_separator(), Move_window(), Readline_ex(), Redefine_control(), Slider_timer(), Wait_click_in_palette(), Wait_click_in_shade_table(), Wait_end_of_click(), Window_clicked_button(), Window_dropdown_on_click(), and Window_normal_button_onclick().

Variable Documentation

int Input_sticky_control

This holds the ID of the GUI control that the mouse is manipulating.

The input system will reset it to zero when mouse button is released, but it's the engine that will record and retrieve a real control ID.

Referenced by Button_Effects(), Move_cursor_with_constraints(), Window_clicked_button(), and Window_get_clicked_button().

int Snap_axis

Allows locking movement to X or Y axis: 0=normal, 1=lock on next move, 2=locked horizontally, 3=locked vertically.

Referenced by Compute_paintbrush_coordinates(), and Release_control().

int Snap_axis_origin_X

For the :Snap_axis mode, sets the origin's point (in image coordinates).

Referenced by Compute_paintbrush_coordinates().

int Snap_axis_origin_Y

For the :Snap_axis mode, sets the origin's point (in image coordinates).

Referenced by Compute_paintbrush_coordinates().
